page.title: 09EDUCATION.
page.content: Children from the village have achieved much, although opportunities are limited. There is a voluntary pre-school playgroup which is held weekly in the village hall. The village primary school housed in a new building is a church foundation. It has a high standard and is very popular. Its register consists of thirty village children with a futher thirty from surrounding villages. From the age of eleven, children travel to the Alderman Peel High School at Wells which is a comprehensive school. To take advantage of further education teenagers and young adults have to travel to Norwich or King's Lynn. Library facilities are provided in the form of a mobile library van run by the education authority.
